cardinfo.CI: Senna - Candle Bush Tree/Candle Bush Tree - Canopy.jpg

V: This plant, a 6 - 25 feet tall, perennial shrub, has erect waxy yellow spikes that resemble fat candles before the individual blossoms open. The large leaves are bilateral - symetrical opposed and fold together at night. The fruit is a pod, while the seeds are small and square. The leaves contain chrysophanic acid. The leaves are reported to be sudorific, diuretic and purgative, being used in the same manner as senna. The leaves are commonly used for ringworm and other skin diseases. The leaves in decoction are also used to treat bronchitis and asthma. Because of it's anti-fungal properties, it is a common ingredient in soaps, shampoos, and lotions in the Philippines.

Hindi: एड़गज, प्रपुन्नाड, Ergaj, Prapunnad
Kannada: ಸೀಮೆ ಅಗಸೆ, Sime agase
Latin: Senna alata
Malayalam: ആനത്തകര, മലന്തകര, Aanattakara, Malamtakara
Marathi: शिमई अगसे, Shimai agase
Tamil: சீமையகத்தி, வண்டுகொல்லி மரம், Seemai agathi, Vantu kolli
